image.altText: Courtroom sketch of a man with a bald head and a beard looking sad

props.synopsis: The trial against a South Australian man accused of murder has been vacated after a jury member allegedly googled information, a court has heard.

title.children: Mistrial declared in alleged murder case after juror googled information, court hears

image.altText: Josh Rachele holds his arms out and yells in celebration

props.synopsis: The Crows have received a major boost ahead of their knockout semifinal against the Hawks, with livewire forward Josh Rachele recalled after a knee injury.

title.children: Crows livewire returns from injury for knockout semi against Hawks

image.altText: Britain's King Charles III with SA Premier Peter Malinauskas.

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas meets with the sovereign on an official visit to the United Kingdom, during which he also signs an agreement with nuclear reactor manufacturer Rolls-Royce regarding the AUKUS submarine agreement.

title.children: King Charles hosts SA premier, who 'would love' royal visit at climate summit

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A driver will face court charged over the deaths of two men in a ute rollover on KI on Wednesday night. In a separate incident in SA's far north, a pedestrian suffered life-threatening injuries when she was hit by a bus on the Stuart Highway.

title.children: Driver charged after two men killed in Kangaroo Island ute rollover

image.altText: Three people in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: Residents in a South Australian town will go to the polls to decide if the larger local supermarkets can open Sundays and public holidays.

title.children: Country town to vote on allowing big supermarkets to open Sundays

image.altText: A woman and a teenage boy each holding a mug while sitting on a couch with a kitchen in the background

props.synopsis: A South Australian mother of a teenager with asthma says it was "irresponsible" of health authorities not to communicate updated advice more widely, amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

title.children: SA mum slams health authorities for 'irresponsible' handling of algal bloom advice

image.altText: A dry outback racecourse, with barriers looping the track, and mountains in the backdrop.

props.synopsis: In SA's Flinders Ranges ovals, golf courses and race tracks help people forget about drought for a brief time, even when they are also dry.

title.children: Dry and dusty sports clubs offer solace to drought-stricken towns

image.altText: The remains of dozens of trees lay on the ground as a sign warns people the area is restricted

props.synopsis: An exotic pest that kills pine trees and can be spread by humans has felled nearly 1,400 trees in Adelaide.

title.children: Pine tree pest threatens $3b forestry industry as more SA trees in danger

image.altText: AAP Jacinta Nampijinpa Price

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley apologises for Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's remarks that "hurt" Indian Australians eight days after they were first made.

title.children: Ley apologises for Nampijinpa Price's remarks about Indian migrants

image.altText: A hand holds a smart phone, showing Jennie on an Instagram feed holding a lipstick.

props.synopsis: Once considered niche, K-beauty products are now everywhere — from luxury department stores to local pharmacies and even supermarkets. It is one of the fastest-growing sectors in the Australian cosmetics landscape.

title.children: South Korea's skincare innovation attracts shoppers and Australian brands

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Shocking allegations of suspected embezzlement at the fertility industry's peak body have been revealed just days before Australia's health ministers meet to decide the future of how the organisation self-regulates the IVF sector.

title.children: Allegations of suspected $3m fraud rock IVF industry

image.altText: Marty Sheargold wearing headphones and speaking on air for Triple M, he has a bald head, greying moustache and beard.

props.synopsis: An Australian media regulator investigation finds radio presenter Marty Sheargold's comments on Triple M "demeaning" and "demonstrated a level of contempt and disdain for women's sport".

title.children: Sheargold's 'sexist' Matildas remarks breached decency rules

image.altText: Larry Ellison sitting in a room at the White House

props.synopsis: The switch in the ranking comes after a blockbuster earnings report from Oracle, powered by multi-billion-dollar orders from customers as the AI race heats up.

title.children: Larry Ellison briefly overtakes Elon Musk as world's richest person

image.altText: Flash flooding inundates Sydney light rail services

props.synopsis: Severe weather has wreaked havoc across the state with intense rain stranding light rail passengers in Randwick and causing a roof collapse near Penrith overnight.

title.children: Heavy rain, flash flooding and powerful winds wreak havoc in Sydney

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and glasses walk down a flight of stairs in front of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Mark Andrew Orford, 53, is charged with two alleged historical assaults and of being a public officer using information to secure a benefit, dating back to 2022.

title.children: SA police officer fronts court on assault and public office abuse charges

image.altText: A mother and son stand side by side and smile at the camera

props.synopsis: The SA government says 473 children have been treated at the Women's and Children's Hospital since 2023, for road trauma related injuries. For Kai Archer, the injuries he sustained in an accident two years ago are still having an impact.

title.children: 'Don't take risks': Kai is among hundreds of young people impacted by road trauma in SA

image.altText: A woman in black cardigan with purple hair looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: After losing two years of her life to a poker machine addiction, Bec Healy wants the SA government to put its revenue from gambling into harm reduction.

title.children: Recovering gambling addict wants 'moral' use for pokies millions

image.altText: A woman in a cream long sleeve shirt stands in front of a dome observatory against a pink and purple sunset sky.

props.synopsis: Just a month after learning of a remote observatory run by a single volunteer, Rebecca Tayler and Richard Wilkin were handed its keys. These days, the observatory is part of a "star trail" for astronomy enthusiasts.

title.children: Outback observatories team up to create bucket list stargazing trail

image.altText: Joe Biden closes eyes as Kamala Harris hugs him on stage at rally

props.synopsis: In an excerpt from her forthcoming book, Kamala Harris says it was reckless to allow former US president Joe Biden to decide to seek re-election in 2024 but she felt she could not advise her boss not to run.

title.children: Harris says allowing Biden to seek re-election was 'recklessness'

image.altText: A farmer in a navy blue jumper leaning on a post, with cattle feeding on hay in a paddock behind him

props.synopsis: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

title.children: In this food bowl region, the alarm is ringing over water supply

image.altText: Man has a serious expression as he sits in front of a radio microphone. He has shoulder length brown hair and wears a cap.

props.synopsis: When AFL player Mitch Brown openly came out as the first bisexual man in AFL history, he wasn't expecting the guilt that followed. While the 36-year-old has "no regrets", he admits he's disappointed by the lack of support from some within the AFL.

title.children: 'I'll walk with you': Mitch Brown's message to next queer AFL player

image.altText: An image of Michael Pell.

props.synopsis: Former AFL umpire Michael Pell leaked information about confidential Brownlow Medal votes and used another man’s account to place bets on the marquee event, police allege.

title.children: AFL umpire faces court over alleged Brownlow betting scam

image.altText: Molly Picklum holds up an Australia flag in the water

props.synopsis: With the stakes and swell continually rising, surfer Molly Picklum can't help but laugh when she entertains the idea of matching Steph Gilmore's title haul.

title.children: Picklum's quest for multiple surfing titles 'a trip' in modern era

image.altText: Jess Fox in a screenshot from her Instagram story announcing she will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships.

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2010, Australian Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships, being held later this month on her home course.

title.children: Jess Fox 'heartbroken' as she is forced to miss home world championships

image.altText: The Gap arrest

props.synopsis: Police allegedly found violent extremist material linked to a proscribed terror organisation during a search of the 18-year-old's property.

title.children: Brisbane man facing terror charges allegedly had chemicals used in explosives

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The local share market is trading lower on Thursday, dragged down by health stocks. Meanwhile, Wall Street's S&P 500 has closed at record highs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls on health stocks, Wall Street's S&P 500 hits record highs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bendigo Bank to axe 145 jobs following ANZ and NAB's mass cull
Have you been affected Cashrewards' shutdown this week?

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese, looking slightly stern as he talks.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has long argued being serious on climate change is the "entry fee" for credibility in the Pacific.

title.children: Albanese government about to settle on Australia's 2035 climate target

image.altText: An aerial shot a beautiful bay with aqua water and a dark band of water

props.synopsis: Tourists flock to Magnetic Island to see its unique coral reefs, but locals say underwater visibility is getting worse — and some blame dredging.

title.children: Floating mud on the Great Barrier Reef's doorstep sparks concern

image.altText: About 10 men photographed holding signs protesting their work conditions

props.synopsis: Melbourne-based company Ansell has confirmed it investigated allegations at a Malaysian factory and identified issues that do not meet labour standards.

title.children: Australian glove-maker Ansell accused of exploiting workers

image.altText: A collapsed building with dirty flood water rushing past in West Denpasar, Bali.

props.synopsis: Bali has been rocked by unusual and deadly flooding as heavy rains inundate homes, major roads and force large evacuations.

title.children: At least 14 dead in Bali floods

image.altText: Silhouette of a gamer's head as they play video games

props.synopsis: With gaming disorders estimated to affect hundreds of thousands nationwide, an Australian-first clinic at Fiona Stanley Hospital is helping people who struggle to control their use to turn their lives around.

title.children: Gaming addiction 'devastates' families, but this clinic is helping them recover

image.altText: A composite image of a greying woman, a middle aged man in his 50s, and a blonde woman of a similar age

props.synopsis: James Murdoch, Elisabeth Murdoch and Prudence MacLeod say they are "pleased" to have reached an agreement to settle litigation over the Murdoch family trust, saying the issue is "now behind them".

title.children: Murdoch children 'pleased' family trust dispute is 'behind them'

image.altText: Army personnel in khaki uniforms hold rifles and walk through a street littered with debris

props.synopsis: After days of deadly riots that killed at least 30 people, a relative calm has been restored in Kathmandu as the army begins negotiations with protest organisers over what happens next.

title.children: Police say 13,500 prisoners escaped custody during deadly Nepal riots

image.altText: Brad Scott and Zach Merrett stand together on Anzac Day

props.synopsis: Essendon has gone from an AFL powerhouse to a cellar-dweller due to its inability to make tough decisions over the last two decades, and now its captain has offered the club a chance to flip the script.

title.children: 'The gloves are off': Zach Merrett's secret meeting a chance for Essendon to get ruthless again

image.altText: pink soap scum on bathroom tiles being scrubbed

props.synopsis: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

title.children: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
